inn1.comm: a good start from Mills, Cook shuffling back and nudging this off the back foot. A touch of movement away from the left-hander
fuller this time and he drives crisply to mid-off
a good length outside off. Cook leaves it alone
driven down the ground for a couple. Neat stroke
excellent ball from Mills - that's the length. Cook, on the back foot, nervously defends off the back foot
well wide and left alone
on his legs, Mustard nudges it to midwicket
again on his legs, again Mustard nudges; again he finds midwicket
Mustard tries to clatter this through the covers but the bat twizzles in his hands and Martin fields smartly in his follow-through
again he unleashes a cover drive but inside-edges to the leg side
a touch of bounce from Martin, and a much better line which rises on Mustard who defends confidently off the back foot
rapped on the pads and a decent shout but it's going over. Much better line
carved down to third man
ah, now that's well bowled from Mills, finding one to hold its line on Mustard who hides his bat behind the pad. A fullish, goodish length - more of that, please
ever so slightly shorter, Mustard angles to point
a swing and a miss! My word, he really laid into that with a great deal of humpty but was beaten by a touch of swing
off his pads, I think? Down the leg side and it's called a wide; McCullum scampers like a crab to his right and does well to save four
an ugly, cross-batted swat off the back foot
well wide of the off stump
well wide of the off stump and ignored
a fuller delivery angling into the left-hander who ignores it, shouldering arms
clunked out on the front foot but without timing
left alone outside off
neatly timed off the back foot
carved off the back foot down to third man
he's timed one! Rejoice! He might even get two for it...but Vettori flings himself to his right at mid-off and saves two. Excellent work
nudged out to mid-off again but Cook's dozing...and here comes the throw, but it's wild and wide
this rises on Cook who defends to point
a quality cut and well timed, but point flies to his right and saves four. Brilliant stuff from New Zealand
nudged out to point again, he calls Cook through for a tip-and-run single and here comes the throw but it's a little wide
left alone outside off
hammered to the very short (in distance, not height) mid-off
elegantly driven...but with absolutely no placement, or indeed power
a touch of swing into Mustard who comes onto the front foot, driving to mid-off
defended to point and again it's a dot ball
full, angling into the left-hander's middle stump and he's right behind it, defending it as though this is a six-day Test match
again firmly blocked out. An excellent ball on the off stump
defended to point and Cook is awake, alive to the single and they get it comfortably
wide of the off stump and he tries to slash this through the covers, but misses it by miles. Oh, it's a wide. How marvellous
on the off stump and he defends out to point
it's a four! Rejoice! Mustard has four whole runs, neatly opening the face and guiding it down to third man. Nicely played
timed off the back foot into the covers
cracked on the front foot
driven out to mid-off
got him! No! Will's got it wrong again. A fish-and-a-miss outside the off stump but only half an appeal from the bowler. McCullum wasn't interested at all
oh hello, what's he doing here? Fuller, and it doesn't really get up on Mustard but he tries to pull it and gets an inside edge. McCullum does well to save four
left alone outside off. A little bit of movement back into the left hander off the seam
elegantly flicked by Mustard through the midwicket region, and he times it well for two
clumped on the front foot to cover - who misfields! Not his fault; it's the pitch which is entirely to blame, and he's nutmugged to allow them through for a single
clunked into the covers. Cook yells "yeh yeh", which Mustard correctly interprets as reason to run
inside edge for four! That was mighty close. Mustard was too late on this fuller delivery which cut back into him, and came tentatively forward, inside-edging it past his off stump
wide of the off stump, he swishes and misses
squared up by a good, straight delivery on his leg stump. He tried to work it through midwicket but got a thick outside edge to cover
he goes for an extravagant pull but inside edges it short of McCullum
that's well bowled. Full, straight and defended
a heavy bottom hand from Mustard, clumping this to mid-on

edged and dropped by McCullum! Cook was static in his crease, trying to crack this off the back foot but he got a thick edge which flew wide of McCullum. He dived spectacularly but couldn't quite hold on
on the off stump, dropped out to cover. Well run
Cook steps to leg and defends - and that's very well run indeed
cautiously defended on the back foot to leg and although he can't time it, they nevertheless scamper through for a single
very slow, and it comes even slower off the pitch. Cook waits and waits for it, cutting to point
bowled him! Cook stepped to leg a little and it cut back off the seam - also keeping a little low - and crept through the gate
ignored outside off
steered behind square on the off for an easy one
outside off, Bell rather cautiously forward and offers no shot
Bell turns into the leg side, sets off as there was never a run there, but he slipped six yards down the track and really had to scramble rather hurriedly to get  back to safety
on his toes and played to backward point. No miscommunication this time as Bell yells "no" very loudly
good length outside off, no shot
pushed behind square on the leg side and Bell's off the mark
pushed up to mid-off
short outside off, Bell leans back and plays a pretty nasty Twenty20-type heave aiming to thump the ball over midwicket ... and misses
lovely diving stop by Oram at backward point, one handed and he is agile enough to have a shy at the bowler's end
turned to midwicket with a shout of "wait on" and wait on they both did
pulled over midwicket off the front foot, no attempt to keep the ball down and he clears the infielders
two steps down the pitch to meet the delivery, pushed to cover
defensive push with an open face straight to backward point
he seemed to hit that hard but it barely dribbled into the covers, between fielders which allowed the single
poked into the covers
left alone
thuds into his pads, a loud appeal from behind the stumps but Oram more interested in fielding the ball which dribbles into the leg side
tries to run the ball to third man but gets all cramped up and the ball ends up nestled at his feet
a very loose drive, a thick inside edge diverts the ball from wide outside off stump into the stumps
wide and full, a flamboyant drive fielded by extra cover. A loud cheer as momentarily the crowd thought it was a catch
full toss driven to mid-off
well forward, an angled bat and backward point fields
slightly short, Pietersen on his toes to defend
banged in and Pietersen slightly surprised, jerking his head back and he pulls into the leg side, almost defensively rather than trying to hit the cover off it
flicked off middle-and-leg to deep midwicket
pushed a few feet into the leg side, Mustard sets off and then stops, Pietersen left slightly at sea and he has to dive back to beat an underarm at the stumps
angled into the slips but not into a gap
premeditated cross-batted heave, he has some luck as a thick bottom edge squirts behind square on the leg side
defended with soft hands up to mid-on, by killing the pace on the ball it was an easy single in the end
pushed defensively into the covers
flicked to deep midwicket, a relay of fielders cannot prevent the second
jags back, he  opens the face of the bat and chops it down to short third man
slower ball, Pietersen waits and drives hard to mid-on
slower and wider, not timed and the ball bobbles back to the bowler
good delivery treated with the utmost respect
straight drive past the bowler, Pietersen quick to see mid-on dawdling and yells for the single which Mustard is up for
straight drive down the ground for a well-run couple
outside off and left with a real flourish, as only Pietersen can. He somehow makes a leave look entertaining
pushed into the leg side
back of a length, defended into the ground
slow and very wide, Pietersen was clearly tempted, seemed to start after it and thought better of it
paddled to midwicket
round the wicket, flat and angled into the left hander
same line, flat and hard to get away ... defended to point
even flatter, pushed back to the left of Styris who is quickly across
tip and run to point, they were both on the same wavelength and the single was easy
turned into the on side
clipped on the walk to long-on
that's the big one ... Pietersen drags the ball into his stumps from wide as he shapes to play into the leg side and the crowd goes wild
a thick edge as he plays off the back foot, quite safe and third man fields
back and defends
short, it sits up and Mustard has to wait and wait before paddling it tennis-style into the leg side
pushed firmly to mid-off and another well-run single. They might be crucial in what looks as if it will be a low-scoring single.
pushed into the on side and cover fields on the bounce
pushed into the off side, defensively
a more ambitious drive but right at mid-off
flat and accurate from round the wicket, nothing for Mustard to get hold of
slightly short, Mustard pulls with power and timing but slap-bang to deep midwicket
drifting to leg, Collingwood turns it round the corner fine enough to allow him to come back for the second
driven gently to cover
outside off, Mustard looks to cut the ball to third man but the ball goes over the top edge
dropped into the leg side but Oram quick to pounce in his follow thorugh
a rather desperate pull ends up with mid-on
clipped to leg with a shout of two, but deep midwicket in very quickly
defensive poke into the off side
top edge as he cuts and it neatly bisects keeper and second slip ... a big gap and his luck was in
poked into the on side, the close fields descends collectively on the ball but can't prevent the single
clipped inches short of Ross Taylor at midwicket, off the bottom of the bat and Taylor's dive almost results in a sensational one-handed catch
he plays all round a ball angled in with the arm, a nothing shot and his vigil comes to an end. The pressure applied by the captain and his parsimonious bowlers finally does for Mustard
straight and McCullum likes that. "Yeh, Scotty, that's it Scotty"
nagging line, open-faced shot to point
patted to shortish midwicket
edgy drive squeezes to point
pushed gently to midwicket
back and patted to extra cover
a period of consolidation ... defended on merit
short and pulled to midwicket, he had to wait for that as it was slower of this surface than he expected
outside off, straight as an arrow, Shah plays well inside the line
pushed off the front foot to cover
placed drive to mid-on
pushed to short cover
driven to short midwicket
seams back slightly and Shah defends
too close to allow him to free his arms, he can only pat it back to the bowler
more air than perhaps expected, driven to deepish mid-on
checked drive beats extra cover and that allows the ambled single
too full, clipped off his toes square on the leg side
wrsity drive and photogenic follow through but no run as extra cover fields
lovely footwork and he really hammers that back past the bowler, it goes like the proverbial rocket
more respect for the last ball of the over, defended very watchfully into space which allows the single
tries to work this to the leg side but misses
defends on the front foot
tries to sweep this around the corner but can't time it. Styris roars an unlikely appeal
tries to hit this over long-on, working it from outside the off stump and it spoons up in the air..but Martin is deep on the long-on boundary and it falls short
driven to mid-off

punched to mid-on and Collingwood ambles through for a single but Shah's not moving at all - trouble here! Collingwood scampers back, dives, and although the throw is wide, McCullum whips off the bails and he's short. Amazingly, none of New Zealand's fielders are interested, and are over the moon that the third umpire has given him out
driven out to cover
full and straight, McCullum shouts "awwww" in the style of Adam Gilchrist
defended on the front foot
comes forward to defend
nudged to leg. McCullum roars an appeal, forgetting that it's hit his bat
angled out to point
defended on the front foot
outside the off stump, guided out to the off stump
defended
spearing into his off stump, guided out to point
guided to mid-on
he tries to work this to leg but misses
punched out to cover
punched to point
excellent, deft footwork - back into his stumps, and he cuts it out to the off side
backs away and cuts it out to cover
he plays and misses outside off
defended out to the off side
punched to mid-on
cut to the off side and they scamper through for a single
whipped to midwicket
spearing into the off stump, he pumps it to mid-on
pushed out to cover
flicked down to fine leg. McCullum skips to his left to field
defended on the front foot
short of a length, Shah nudges out to the off side
outside leg, Bopara prods it to leg
whipped straight to midwicket
on the off stump, whipped back to the bowler
back cut to point
defended on the front foot
defended on the front foot
hook, line and sinker. Short of a length, Bopara pulls it straight down Fulton's throat at deep square leg
nobbled out to the off side
elegantly timed and powerfully struck to mid-off
this keeps low on Swann who opens the face and times it to backward point
punched back to the bowler
duller and flatter, squeezed out on the front foot
neatly played by Swann, dropping it out and he flies through for a single
punchily defended off the back foot
spearing into his off stump, Shah defends

down the pitch, he pads it away and Vettori roars an appeal for lbw. Shah calls him through for a single; Swann forgets to listen and sends Shah back, but Shah's already too far down the pitch so here comes Swann...and here comes the throw, but it's wide
nudged to leg
defended on the front foot
paddled around the corner
an off-cutter from Styris which is defended
really well played, whipping it through midwicket and Taylor gives chase. Will he get there? No! A hapless dive, Taylor lands on the turf like a beached whale and it goes for four
down the leg side
Shah comes confidently forward, pushing it out to cover
outside the off stump. Shah's forward, smothering
quicker ball and very close to bowling Shah! He was so late on it but somehow got bat on it
punched out to the off side
bending back into Swann and cramping him for room, he cuts late
again a touch of movement in the air, swinging back into the right hander who's solid in defence
this holds its line on Swann who guides it to Jamie How at backward point. A quick, flat throw into McCullum who whips off the bails and Swann's short by a foot
spearing into his pads, he defends
rapped on the pads and a big, big shout...but I think he's hit outside the line. Just...
whipped to leg

punched out to the off side, oh dear - more trouble here for England as the throw comes in from cover. McCullum whips off the bails and he looks to be at least a foot short of his ground. The third umpire, Billy Bowden, is taking an age - two minutes and counting - to make a decision as there's some debate as to whether McCullum had the ball in his gloves at the point of the bails falling off. But he's eventually given out
forward,a  thin edge scoots to short third man and England manage a run without associated alarms
on with the arm and it beats the prod forward
back, turned all along the ground to mid-on but that doesn't stop McCullum yelling "catch it"
back and very correctly defended
outside off and left alone
forward and a hunched defensive prod
punched from the crease to mid-on
Sidebottom happy to play safe for a bit
the turn takes a thick edge but along the ground
half forward, this time an inside edge which squirts to short fine leg
turned round his pad to square leg, McCullum quickly out of the blocks to field
wide, he feels for it and almost gets the edge
Vettori bang on the button
pushed through, Sidebottom back and blocks
steered off the outside edge to short third man Sidebottom sets off but is quickly sent back
worked defensively square on the leg side
flatter and turned to midiwicket
well forward and pushed defensively to extra cover
and again forward early to defend
back onto his stumps and helped round to long leg
driven from wide of the stumps to cover
floated up a bit more, beats the bat and plops off the pads into the off side
looped more and driven to cover who makes a sliding stop and removes a large divot of grass in the process
right back on his stumps and jumpily defended
once again Broad opts to play with a rather nervy step back into his crease
placed between mid-on and midwicket for a rare run
patted into the off side
defended to short midwicket
solid but unspectacular push to point
fired down the leg side and really well taken low down by McCullum
straight and quite some turn, Broad defends
patted to mid-on
well forward, a thick inside edge goes to really short midwicket ... well, he's ambled in to short leg and acquired a helmet without us noticing
ironic cheers as Broad finds the gap at midwicket and they run two
lovely conventional left-armer's spin beats Broad's lunge
swept with heaps of premeditation - he was almost in position as Patel reached the crease - but perfectly well and fine leg fields
back, into the off side where there is a virtual barrier of fielders
uncertain push back down the pitch
straight and treated with respect
short and hooked uppishly for the first boundary in nine overs
driven square on the off side with a bit of a wristy follow thorugh
checked push to mid-on
a thick edge races through the slips and that's the off-side run stat out of the window
flatter and on with the arm, Sidebottom forward and right over the ball
fuller, he gives himself room to drive into the covers
short, lots of spin, he steps back to cut but it gets too big on him, and McCullum whips off the bails as well although the batsman's feet were planted well behind the craese
cut to slip where it is well stopped by the man just put in there
floated up and Sidebottom content to stay there
played back to the bowler
another delivery on the spot, Broad back and blocks once more
driven crisply to extra cover
worked to leg, midwicket races in from the deep to fire in a flat return
faster and fuller, Sidebottom blocks. He's became a really obdurate batsman as he showed in Sri Lanka before Christmas
angled quite deliberately to point
tossed up, driven to cover
back and turned behind square
droppeda thick edge off a defensive poke, it takes the bottom of McCullum's gloves and goes down
a leading edge and it is hard to imagine a softer catch, Patel just stood there and it looped apologetically to him.  Sidebottom was done by a tad extra bounce
forward and defended
steps back and drives into the ground, cover fields
worked into space on the leg side
slower ... much slower ... outside off and full, Anderson watches it pass
patted to extra cover who waits as it just about reaches him
no footwork, a loose drive, and he misses by some way
he is turned square as he looks to nurdle to leg, gets a leading edge and the ball trundles into the off side
pushed at the ball and gets a thick edge which heads off all along the ground to third man
flat, full and defended
steps back and hits hard to extra cover for the first run in front of square on the off side in ten overs
an embarrassment of riches ... cut to deep point
forward and he almost plays all round it but uses edge and pads to keep it out
missed sweep from way outside of stump
checked block, Patel quickly across to field
driven confidently to long-off
fractionally short, but not as short as Anderson thought, and he jumps back as befits a No.11 and plays into the off side
banged in and Anderson ducks and takes the ball on the gloves ... it could have gone anywhere but it dropps into space on the off side and he is delighted to get down the other end
clipped uppishly through midwicket but there's nobody there - they are all out deep for Broad in the final overs
slower ball, punched to cover
on leg stump, Anderson almost falls over as he tries to play it and ends up missing it by some way
swept on the full very fine and brilliantly stopped one handed by How at full stretch to his left
Anderson prods and gets enough of an edge to steer it past McCullum. there's a man a third man for  such edges
a heave heads up to long-on
fuller, Patel appeals for leg before but Rauf looks slightly amused as the ball has clattered into the stumps off Anderson's pads

inn2.comm: good length and a hint of swing away from the left-handed Ryder who leaves it alone. Encouraging pace from Sidebottom, that first one fired down at 85mph
and a swing and a miss from Ryder to a quicker, fuller delivery outside his off stump
ooh and he's beaten by a fine delivery which bends away from him at the last moment. Ryder's feet are concreted and he pokes and misses
movement off the pitch this time. Ryder wisely leaves it alone
very well bowled on the off stump. Ryder's forward, defending it solidly
left alone outside the off stump
McCullum marches down the pitch like a madman and gets a thick outside edge, which rockets over point and down to third man
touch too full. Ryder shuffles into position and punches out to the off side
nudged to leg for a single and the big lad's off the mark
McCullum tries to work this to leg but is beaten by the swing, bending away from him, and it's smudged out to cover
carved off a thick outside edge down to third man. He tried to smack it over the top but got it off the edge
beaten for pace, here, as Ryder tries to whip this through midwicket but is rapped on the pads
McCullum is again down the pitch but Sidebottom finds one to bend back into him
ooh that was mighty, mighty close. McCullum took a step to leg, trying to clatter this over extra cover but got a thick inside edge which nearly bowled him
McCullum steps to the off side this time, and down the pitch, and is rapped on the pads
calmly left alone outside off
but he's got hold of this one, pulling it powerfully over midwicket for four
guided out to cover
too full and Ryder climbs into it, without placing it though, and it's clunked to cover
what a shot that is! The first six of the day, he just flicked it off middle stump into the midwicket stands. Nothing more than a flick
stroked out to cover
more leg-side dross from Anderson, Ryder turns it to square leg
oh yes. Shot of the day. Far too full from Anderson, yet again, and McCullum just drives through the line and over the top. Wonderful timing
he's absolutely laced that! But straight to point
pushed out to the off side
good length and attacking Ryder's off stump, he defends
full and straight, Ryder is solid in defence off the back foot. Good pace and a good line
again that's nicely bowled, full and fast and it's nudged to leg but Sidebottom scampers to his left to field
bang! That is an extraordinary shot. He flayed his hands at it outside off and absolutely laced it for four, the ball falling a couple of inches short of the extra cover rope
rapped on the pads but it's down the leg side
on his legs, McCullum whips it through midwicket with one hand off the bat
again on his legs, McCullum turns it into the gap at midwicket and they scamper a single. Excellent running by McCullum
defended out to cover
much better length from Anderson. Ryder, on the back foot, defends
clunked out to the off side
powerfully punched to point
very full from Sidebottom and it cuts back into the right hander who tries to cut, but he's rapped on the pads
good grief. McCullum steps down the pitch at least two metres, before Sidebottom had even reached his delivery stride
carved down to third man
very full from Sidebottom and Ryder clips it straight. Sidebottom tumbles and fields
slower ball from Sidebottom which is defended
hoiked over mid-on for a couple
a very good line and length and McCullum inside edges it onto his pad, then out to cover
too short, pulled through midwicket
shuffles to leg, Anderson follows him and it nobbles off his pad
a thick outside edge - deliberately carved - down to third man, which is square and short
pushes this out to the off side
oh that's a beautiful stroke from Ryder, albeit to another awful delivery from Anderson. Down the leg side, he whipped it wide of the short fine-leg for four
a wide yorker, McCullum slaps it to mid-off
a touch slower, Ryder waits for it before sweetly timing it out square of the wicket, but he can't bisect the fielders
immense power from Ryder. It wasn't that short, but he has tremendously fast hands and pulled this off the front foot with great power through midwicket
a very quick bouncer, beating Ryder's attempted hook
tries to swing this through midwicket but missed
oh no, he's dropped him! Graeme Swann at short midwicket, unable to hang on to a powerfully flicked flick
on his legs, Ryder whips it to short fine leg
keeps very low on Ryder - it only just sailed over the stumps
on his legs, Broad roars an appeal but it's just sliding down leg. Good length from Broad
full and straight and defended
pulled through midwicket with power
defended to leg
short, too short to hook and he goes down on one knee and allows it through
slower and up in the blockhole, Ryder waits and steers it with an open face to the man at deep backward point
outside off and left
wow, he seized on that really early and lofted the ball ten row back over wide long-on, out of the middle and that flew
down the leg side and swinging wider, an easy call for the umpire
McCullum takes two strides to meet the ball, it goes back to Sidebottom who scratchily feigns a shy at the stumps and the crowd boo him for his efforts
turned to leg, no more than a dozen yards from the crease, but an easy single nonetheless
leans back and cuts square on the off side to the man in the deep
Ryder waiting to see what Swann has on offer
gently cut into the off side, no real intent to score off it
"beautiful Swanny".  Not really, but flat, faster and no run
swept from outside the off stump through midwicket, well timed
as horrible as the previous shot was sweet, he tries a repeat and ends up swinging at air and looking like a club biffer
leans back and deliberately steers the ball over the slips, Anderson at third man is in quickly but it falls five yards short of him

what a mess! Short, Mustard fumbles, Ryder sets off, Mustard shies and misses and the big man would have been short of his ground had he hit ... he wasn't even trying to get back so far out would he have been and Broad, backing up the original throw, had another go and Mustard backed that up!
swung to leg, Anderson makes good ground to field
poked into the covers
he waits and then opens the face very late on, the ball goes square but to the fielder
pulled from outside off, it was there to hit but Ryder caught it too high on the bat, Luke Wright at deep midwicket came in off the boundary and held a routine catch
up at his feet, clipped to deep midwicket who ambles in to field
pushed to mid-on
very correct, a big stride forward and hunched defensive shot
leans back and hits that very hard to deepish cover
dropped ... bat-pad, it loops into the leg side, Mustard makes a mass of ground, holds the ball as he dives full length but as he hits the ground the ball spills out of his gloves
salt in the wound ... inside-out drive over long-off
played with firm hands from some way in front of the body, behind square on the off for a single
well placed into the off side, McCullum like a greyhound wants the three but How not as eager
short, pulled along the ground to deep midwicket
upright defensive poke to cover
turned off leg stump wide of midwicket, a long chase for the man out in the deep
played off the back foot to mid-on
cut to deep backward point, controlled and easy
upright and blocked, his right leg comes round as he plays that shot and he ends up completely square on
a more conventional defensive prod into the covers
pushed back to the bowler
firmer defensive push to deepish cover
no more than a little prod, it beats Collingwood, McCullum jumps to allow it to pass and they stroll a single
How showing what a good blocker he is
firm and technically perfect defensive push into the off side
driven with no power to extra cover ... looked good and he held the pose for the cameras as well
a simliar shot but much straighter, Broad drops to his left and stuns the ball and mid-off does the rest
a very unHowish shot, short and he aimed a pull, got in a mess and a top edge looped a few yards into he off side and dropped short of inrushing fielders and bowler
back into the mold, defended with no frills
wicket to wicket, blocked
wide, hammered past a sprawling cover but with a man in the deep, only the one
patted to mid-off
clipped wide of wide mid-on but not wide enough
bouncer, which at his pace is about as gift-wrapped a boundary as you can ever ask for, McCullum helps it down into the wide open space at long leg
hunched jab into space on the off side
McCullum walks to meet the ball, pats it into the off side and carries on for the single
wide and full, begging to be driven, How completely mistimes his stroke and Broad fields a bobbler
steered to third man from wide of the off stump

strangled down the leg side ... it clipped something as McCullum looked to flick the ball off his hips, he turned his back on the umpire as Broad and Mustard appealed, and the groan from the crowd told him that the umpire's finger was up
he is greeted with a decent bouncer which he ducks
a nervous single to get off the mark, into the covers but Taylor would have beaten the throw at the bowler's end even if it had hit, but he had to dive
forward, a thick edge scoots to backward point
swished to midwicket
patted to mid-off, no chance of anything there
and Taylor immediately drives along the ground to the man who has just moved back!
checked drive to extra cover
clipped firmly to conventional square leg
dead batted towards mid-on but short midwicket intercepts
firm poke to cover
swinging into Taytor who drives to mid-on
short, he drops onto one knee as if about to receive communion and Mustard takes
short, Taylor goes for the pull but mistimes it and midwicket hardly has his hands stung
punched to short extra cover
firm drive off one knee but well stopped by a dicing short cover
turned around his front pad to midwicket
"yes Colly" barks Mustard. Straight and pushed to short cover
short and he is on that super quick, hammering it past midwicket and no chance for the man in the deep
turned behind square to Sidebottom who is patrolling the distant boundary
slower ball which is patted to mid-off
punched off the back foot to mid-off and they have already decided to take the single as the man is back on the edge of the circle
fired it at his feet, he falls over as he shapes to push through midwicket, he was back on his crease but that looked to be heading down the leg side despite the raucous appeal
pushed to the off
good length at 77mph, not near his fastest, and defended
wide enough to encourage the drive but he doesn't time it and an inside edge goes into his pads and out into the covers
wide - almost far enough from him that he needed a cue extension - but slashed square on the off side
and he gets some more tap from the off ... short, pulled with power over midwicket to loud cheers
half volley turned off his toes to deep square leg
better line and length, treated with respect as he plays it off the back foot
turned to the right of midwicket
back onto his stumps and patted to short extra cover
the bottom hand slips off the handle as he drives it through the covers, Bopara chases, dives but takes the ball over the rope with him
squirted to point
slower - 71mph - and firmly clipped off his toes to deep square leg
thick edge, the ball shoots along the ground and Mustard down to his right quickly to cut it off
so many slower balls that at this rate his stock ball will start to be called his faster one ... again worked square on the leg side
firm and deliberate push to backward point, Collingwood dives, stops, and throws at the bowler's end with a real scowl
short, pulled behind square but not too much power
he misses with a sweep, the ball clips the pads, clips Mustard's gloves and bobbles behind
a stride, he prods, misses, and the ball lollops into the covers
firm drive, Swann drops to his right and takes all the pace off the ball and it barely has enough oomph to dislodge the bails as it dribbles into the stumps
clean sweep to the man in the deep
pushed into the off
swept off one knee over midwicket and half a dozen rows back. Lovely pick-up
dead batted to mid-off
long hop, on it in a trice and even though the man out in the deep only had five yards to move to his right, he had no chance of cutting it off
wider drifting across him, too short to try to drive - but he does nevertheless - and a thin but audible edge is taken by Mustard
slanted across the new batsman but unlike the man he replaced, he's not tempted to nibble
fuller but heading towards the slips, Styris shoulders arms
back and dropped into the ground at his feet
full, pushed back helpfully to Broad who picks up, turns on his heels and strides back
no hurry for the batsmen, another defensive push to mid-off
eye of a needle ... no more than a firm push but it threads through extra cover and mid-off, they give chase but it teases them all the way before skipping over the rope
pushed between the cover fielders
slightly short, he stands on tip toes and dead bats the ball to cover
short, he looks to finish the match with a big hit but top edges a hook, Sidebottom in quickly off the boundary and slides in taking a good, low catch in his fingertips
wicket to wicket, Taylor ready to wait as long as it takes for the bad ball
a thick edge scoots along the ground to backward point who makes a decent tumbling save
outside off and the ball barely gets above calf height as it scurries through to the keeper. Taylor gives a startled-accusing look at the surface
slashed drive along the ground to third man
a foot outside off, safe to leave given the angle of attack
patted to cover
hit on the pads so far outside the line that you could see all three stumps behind him ... but Broad still yells a loud and long appeal
heaved to deep square leg
a loose drive, the ball keeps low, takes the edge and bumbles to third man
short, he pulls out of an intended swipe to leg quite late on
a big swing, a big miss and the ball heads past the off stump to Mustard
and that's it, but a horrible swish through mid-on to seal the win
